Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & R 400.4159 Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Section prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Description Rule 159. (1) A childcaring institution, including private secure
juvenile justice facilities, shall establish a process improvement
and restraint reduction/elimination plan that:
(b) Requires staff training in approved crisis prevention and
intervention techniques including:
(i) Prevention, de-escalation techniques, and non-violent
responses to assaultive behavior
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 5/19/24, Youth A spit and hit Staff 1 and Staff 1 attempted to
restrain Youth A in response. Other staff came to assist, but
Youth A continued to pursue Staff 1. Staff 1 came towards Youth
A. Youth A pushed Staff 1 into a wall, and they fell onto the floor.
There were no injuries.
Investigation This complaint was transferred to DCWL and assigned on
05/20/2024.
JJ Worker was contacted via telephone on 05/21/2024 and a
message was left requesting a return call.
Chief Administrator (CA) was interviewed at the facility on
05/22/2024. Chief Administrator reported on 05/19/2024 there was
an incident involving Youth A and Staff 1. CA reviewed video
footage of the incident and found Youth A was escalated and spit
and pushed Staff 1. Staff 1 appeared to be talking to Youth A,
then Staff 1 can be seen becoming more aggressive; almost as if
he is wanting to fight Youth A. Youth A then began chasing Staff
1, Youth A then pushed Staff 1 into the wall, and they both fell on
the floor. She said Initially Staff 1 appeared to be attempting to
verbally deescalate Youth A, but as Youth A becomes more
escalated Staff 1 also appears to become more aggressive. She
said Staff 1 should have left the Pod when Security Officer and
Supervisor came to the Pod. CA said Staff 1 has been put on
administrative leave pending the investigation.
Youth A was interviewed at the facility on 05/22/2024. Youth A
has been at the facility for two years and has completed the
program. Youth A is currently placed on Pod 1. Youth A reported
he and Youth B were arguing and Staff 1 tried to separate the two
2

Youths. Youth A denied being restrained. Youth A admitted he
pushed Staff 1 and that’s when Staff 1 got in his face and wanted
to fight Youth A. Youth A said Supervisor and Security office came
and separated them. Youth A denied being injured.
Youth B was interviewed at the facility on 05/22/2024. Youth B
has been at the facility for two months and is on Pod 1. Youth B
reported on 05/19/2024 Youth A was trying to fight him and Staff 1
intervened. Youth B said he saw Youth A push Staff 1 and
security was called to assist. Youth B did not see Youth A being
restrained. Youth B did not express any concerns regarding the
facility or staff.
Youth C was interviewed at the facility on 05/22/2024. Youth C
has been at the facility for one year and is on Pod 1. Youth C
reported he was in the treatment room and did not witness the
incident between Youth A and Staff 1. Youth C reported feeling
safe and all his needs are being met.
Supervisor was interviewed at the facility on 05/22/2024.
Supervisor reported on 05/19/2024, she came on Pod 1 to assist
with de-escalating Youth A. She said Staff 1 was attempting to
verbally de-escalate Youth A, who was arguing with Youth B.
Youth A became more aggressive and pushed Staff 1. Staff 1 then
came up close to Youth A and that’s when Youth A pushed Staff
1. She and Security Officer attempted to separate Youth A and
Staff 1. Youth A ran around them to Staff 1, punched Staff 1 in the
chest and Youth A and Staff 1 fell to the floor. She and Security
Officer separated Youth A and Staff 1 and got Staff 1 off the Pod.
She didn’t witness Youth A being restrained by Staff 1.
Security Officer was interviewed at the facility on 05/22/2024.
Security Officer reported on 05/19/2024 he was called to Pod 1
because Youth A was trying to fight with Youth B. Security Officer
reported he immediately had to step in between Staff 1 and Youth
A because it appeared as if they were going to fight. He said both
Staff 1 and Youth A were both very upset. Security Officer said
Youth A got around him and pushed Staff 1 and Staff 1 and Youth
A fell to the floor. He and Supervisor separated Staff 1 and Youth
A and got Staff 1 off the Pod.
Staff 1 was interviewed via telephone on 05/31/2024. Staff 1 has
been working at the facility for three months and completed all
training including Handle with Care. Staff 1 reported on
05/19/2024 Youth A was trying to fight Youth B and he was
attempting to verbally de-escalate him, but Youth A became mad
3

at Staff 1 and came after him. Staff 1 denied he tried to fight or hit
Youth A. Staff 1 said he was attempting to verbally de-escalate
Youth A and may have gotten too close, but he was not trying to
fight Youth A. He denied restraining Youth A.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 05/19/2024 in the common area of Pod 1 was
reviewed on 05/22/2024 (Note: video has no audio). Youth A and
Youth B appeared to be talking, Staff 1 walked towards Youth A,
they exchanged words and Youth A pushed Staff 1. Staff 1
attempted to restrain Youth A, Youth A got away, Staff 1 was
standing facing Youth A in close proximity and appeared ready to
fight Youth A. Security Officer and Supervisor attempted to
separate Staff 1 and Youth A. Youth A ran up to Staff 1 and they
both fell to the floor.
Documents Reviewed:
• Incident report dated 05/19/2024 written by Supervisor.
Report is consistent with Supervisor’s interview.
• Staff 1 training record reviewed: Crisis intervention -verbal
de-escalation and physical practicum completed
02/08/2024 and 02/09/2024. Staff 1 has no disciplinary
action.
• Facility’s Handle with Care Behavior Management Policy:
De-escalates emotional situations and performs individual
restraints and physical interventions as the situation
requires. Staff is to act quickly and respond to all
emergencies with appropriate techniques, (e.g. verbal de-
escalation techniques, safe physical management
techniques, emergency procedures, first aid, CPR, etc.)
Analysis Based on video footage reviewed, interviews, and documents
reviewed, violation is established. The staff responded
inappropriately by getting in Youth A’s face in an aggressive
manner, which is not an approved de-escalation technique.
Conclusion Violation Established
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
